articles.content:
S. Korean Railway Workers Call General Strike 
    Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- The Railway Workers' Union of south Korea held a rally with an attendance of over 5,000 members on Nov. 14, calling a general strike, etc., according to south Korea's KBS.
 The rally was called when a special collective bargaining ran into a blind alley over the pending issue related to projects of the Railroad Administration for next year. At the rally, the union decided to stage all-out struggles including a general strike.

articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Delegation 
    Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by a delegation of the China Association for International Friendly Contact on a visit to the DPRK.
 It was handed to an official concerned by head of the delegation Xing Yunming, vice-president of the China Association for International Friendly Contact.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets UNGA President
articles.content:
Paek Nam Sun Meets New Cuban Ambassador 
    Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister of the DPRK Paek Nam Sun met and conversed with new Cuban Ambassador e. p. to the DPRK Ruben Perez Valdes who paid a courtesy call on him Thursday.
 On hand were an official concerned of the DPRK and the political councilor of the Cuban embassy here.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop Meets Chinese Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets UNGA President
    Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly conversation with President of the UN General Assembly Jean Ping, minister of State and concurrently minister of Foreign Affairs, Cooperation and Francophone of Gabon, and his party at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.
 On hand were Choe Su Hon, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and officials concerned.
